org.jtimer

Class Grapher

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • org.jtimer.Grapher

  • public class Grapher
extends javafx.application.Application
    The object that graphs all the data. For all intents and purposes, this class is a Singleton class and multiple instances of it should not be run.
    Author:
    MagneticZero

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javafx.application.Application

      private void finish()

      Gets the XS and YS of a series, used by lineOfBestFit()
      private void lineOfBestFit()
      Calculates the line of best fit using linear regression.
      private void prettifyView()
      "Prettifies" a graph by limiting the view of it to within maxDeviations standard deviations Also makes the data points on the graph a bit smaller since they're too big by default.

      This sets the grapher for the Singleton grapher class

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Starts the grapher by labeling the axes, adding key listeners, and various other things that pertain to the grapher.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        stage - the primary stage

      • setGraphTitle

        public void setGraphTitle(java.lang.String graphTitle)
        Sets the graph title. If the time method is still running it will append a percentage to the end of the title
        Parameters:
        graphTitle - The title to set it to

      • setProgress

        public void setProgress(java.lang.Double progress)
        Used to set the progress of the graph so that the user knows that something is actually happening. This is formatted to only 2 decimals places.
        Parameters:
        progress - The progress that has been completed

      • setxDesc

        public void setxDesc(java.lang.String xDesc)
        Sets the string for the x-axis
        Parameters:
        xDesc - The string for the x-axis

      • setyDesc

        public void setyDesc(java.lang.String yDesc)
        Sets the string for the y-axis
        Parameters:
        yDesc - The string for the y-axis

      • setMax

        public void setMax(double max)
        Sets the maximum value that the graph will graph. By default this is Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY
        Parameters:
        max - The maximum value

      • setMaxDeviations

        public void setMaxDeviations(double maxDeviations)
        Maximum amount of deviations the graph will show by default this is 2, so data only within 2 standard deviations will be shown.
        Parameters:
        maxDeviations - The maximum amount of deviations

      • setGrapher

        public static void setGrapher(Grapher grapher0)
        This sets the grapher for the Singleton grapher class
        Parameters:
        grapher0 - The grapher to be set

      • start

        public static Grapher start()
        Starts the grapher, this is what should be used to create a grapher instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the grapher instance created.

      • finish

        private void finish()
        Finishes a graph by:
        • Adding all the data
        • Calculating lines of best fit
        • Limiting the graph view
        • Allows toggling of data

      • prettifyView

        private void prettifyView()
        "Prettifies" a graph by limiting the view of it to within maxDeviations standard deviations Also makes the data points on the graph a bit smaller since they're too big by default.

      • lineOfBestFit

        private void lineOfBestFit()
        Calculates the line of best fit using linear regression.
        CURRENTLY AN EXPERIMENTAL FEATURE

      • getData

        private double[][] getData(javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Number> series)
        Gets the XS and YS of a series, used by lineOfBestFit()
        Parameters:
        series - The series
        Returns:
        A double[][] of xs and ys
